front.reference:
ANTIMICROBIAL AGENTS AND CHEMOTHERAPY, Sept. 1979, p. 329-332
Vol. 16, No. 3

docTitle.titlePart:
Na-Cocoyl-L-Arginine Ethyl Ester, DL-Pyroglutamic Acid Salt,
As an Inactivator of Hepatitis B Surface Antigen

byline.affiliation: Division of Chemotherapy, Pharmaceutical Institute, School ofMedicine, Keio University, Shinjuku-ku,

front.div:
Na-Cocoyl-L-arginine ethyl ester, DL-pyroglutamic acid salt (CAE), exhibited a
strong inactivating effect on hepatitis B surface antigen. Concentrations of CAE
required for 50 and 100% inactivation of the antigen were 0.01 to 0.025% and 0.025
to 0.05%, respectively.
